publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-11-30 14:02:58 -0500.

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Items are five black and white snapshots of campers and staff at Camp Arcola, Pennsylvania in 1935. Camp Arcola was a state-operated, federally-funded program for young women equivalent to the CCC for young men. Alice Scardino appears in two group photographs, identification written on back of photographs. Included are reference photocopies of 25 black and white snapshots of U.S. Socialist Party related events and people circa 1930s. The original photographs of the photocopied images are in the possession of the Ostrows' daughter, Dani Danzig.
See Harry Lopatin Photography Collection (PHOTOS 90) for related images.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Separated from Pierson and Alice Ostrow Papers (TAM 288). The accession number associated with this transfer is 2009.076.
The Pierson and Alice Ostrow Papers were donated by Dani Danzig, the daught of Pierson and Alice Ostrow, in 2002. The accession number associated with this gift is 2002.019.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Pierson and Alice Ostrow, the creator of this collection, were relinquished and transferred to the public domain in 2014 by Dani Ostrow Danzig Gammel.
